definitions.definition: A person presiding over a meeting.

A substance that has effects similar to opium.
Any of the natural substances, such as an endorphin, released in the body in response to pain.

To add up; to calculate the sum of.

definitions.definition: To equal a total of; to amount to.

definitions.definition: To demolish; to wreck completely. (from total loss)

definitions.definition: The first showing of a film, play or other form of entertainment, often held as a special event with celebrity guests.

In a series of narrative works, the installment that is chronologically set first.

Of a film or play, to play for the first time.

definitions.definition: To present a film or play for the first time.

definitions.definition: (of a person) Having affection or warm regard; loving; fond.

definitions.definition: (of an action, etc.) Characterised by or proceeding from affection; indicating love; tender.

definitions.definition: Eager; passionate; strongly inclined toward something.

Having green as its color.

definitions.definition: (of people) Sickly, unwell.

definitions.definition: Unripe, said of certain fruits that change color when they ripen.

definitions.definition: (of people) Naive or unaware of obvious facts.

definitions.definition: Environmentally friendly.
Describing a pitch which, even if there is no visible grass, still contains a significant amount of moisture.
Of bacon or similar smallgoods: unprocessed, raw, unsmoked; not smoked or spiced.
Not fully roasted; half raw.
Of freshly cut wood or lumber that has not been dried: containing moisture and therefore relatively more flexible or springy.

definitions.definition: High or too high in acidity.
Full of life and vigour; fresh and vigorous; new; recent.

definitions.definition: Having a sexual connotation.
Having a color charge of green.
Being or relating to the green currencies of the European Union.

definitions.definition: A newcomer; a recent immigrant.

Cause and effect; causality.

definitions.definition: A thick heavy fabric into which raised patterns have been woven, originally in gold and silver; more recently any cloth incorporating raised, woven patterns.
An item decorated with brocade.
Any of several species of noctuid moths such as some species in the genera Calophasia and Hadena
(metaphoric) A decorative pattern.
To decorate fabric with raised woven patterns.
A receptacle for ash and butts from cigarettes and cigars.
Any of numerous marine plants and algae, such as a kelp.
A family of theories and methods within the field of psychotherapy that work to find connections among patients' unconscious mental processes
Tending to hesitate, wait, or proceed with caution or reservation.
definitions.example: I am hesitant to recommend him as a manager because he has a short temper.

definitions.definition: To be superior in strength, dominance, influence or frequency; to have or gain the advantage over others; to have the upper hand; to outnumber others.
definitions.example: Red colour prevails in the Canadian flag.

definitions.definition: To be current, widespread or predominant; to have currency or prevalence.
definitions.example: In his day and age, such practices prevailed all over Europe.

definitions.definition: To succeed in persuading or inducing.
definitions.example: I prevailed on him to wait.

definitions.definition: To avail.
Integrated circuit; microprocessor.
To fit (an animal) with a microchip.
The light emitted by a candle.
A hymn or chant dedicated to a particular saint, or to the Virgin Mary
Dedicated or given in fulfillment of a vow or pledge
definitions.example: She placed a votive offering at the shrine.

definitions.definition: Of, expressing or symbolizing a vow. Often used to describe thick cylindrical candles found in many churches, lit when making a private vow or asking a private intention.
definitions.example: The church was lit by votive candles.

definitions.definition: A light, thin, flat biscuit/cookie.
(christianity) A thin disk of consecrated unleavened bread used in communion.
A soft disk originally made of flour, and later of gelatin or a similar substance, used to seal letters, attach papers etc.
A thin disk of silicon or other semiconductor on which an electronic circuit is produced.
The operation or function that returns the remainder of one number divided by another.
Given a specified modulus of.
definitions.example: 21 and 84 are congruent to each other modulo 9, since both numbers leave the same remainder, 3, when divided by 9.

definitions.definition: Except for differences accounted for by.
definitions.example: "A is the same as B modulo C" means A is the same as B except for differences accounted for by C.

definitions.definition: (extended use) With due allowance for (a specified exception or particular detail).
definitions.example: All mammals, modulo the monotremes, give birth to live young.

definitions.definition: A branching and bony structure on the head of deer, moose and elk, normally in pairs. They are grown and shed each year. (Compare with horn, which is generally not shed.)
definitions.example: While hiking in the woods, I found an antler from a deer.

definitions.definition: A type of small open pie, or piece of pastry, containing jelly or conserve; a sort of fruit pie.
A prostitute.
By extension, any woman with loose sexual morals.
To practice prostitution
To practice promiscuous sex
To dress garishly, ostentatiously, whorishly, or sluttily
To move in a prissy or stereotypically gay way.
definitions.example: nancing around in tight pants

definitions.definition: An effeminate man, especially a homosexual.
A large shrub or small tree of subtropical and tropical areas of the Americas, Byrsonima crassifolia, bearing a small, sweet, yellow fruit.
A form of physical punishment in which a beating is applied to the buttocks.
definitions.example: Domestic spanking is often endured over the knee (or lap), formal spanking rather applied over a contraption such as a tresle or A-frame, with or without constraints

definitions.definition: An incident of such punishment, or such physical act in a non-punitive context, such as a birthday spanking.
Idle talk; senseless prattle
Inarticulate speech; constant or confused murmur.
A sound like that of water gently flowing around obstructions.
To utter words indistinctly or unintelligibly; to utter inarticulate sounds
definitions.example: The men were babbling, so we couldn't make sense of anything.

definitions.definition: To talk incoherently; to utter meaningless words.
To talk too much; to chatter; to prattle.
To make a continuous murmuring noise, like shallow water running over stones.
definitions.example: Hounds are said to babble, or to be babbling, when they are too noisy after having found a good scent.

definitions.definition: To utter in an indistinct or incoherent way; to repeat words or sounds in a childish way without understanding.
To reveal; to give away (a secret).
Part of a website where visitors can converse in typed messages.
Any treatment received before some other process.
Prior to treatment.
Ultra-short or reduced vowel in Proto- and Late Common Slavonic (or Slavic), then represented as ъ (back jer [ŭ]) or ь (front jer [ĭ]).
Marked by pessimism and little hopefulness; expecting the worst.
definitions.example: a pessimistic view of the future

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the worst-case scenario.
definitions.example: a pessimistic estimate

definitions.definition: Taking out exclusive locks on data to prevent conflicts with other processes that might modify it.
definitions.example: pessimistic concurrency; pessimistic locking

definitions.definition: A cavity, hollow, or recess, generally within the thickness of a wall, for a statue, bust, or other erect ornament. Hence, any similar position, literal or figurative.
A function within an ecological system to which an organism is especially suited.
(by extension) Any position of opportunity for which one is well-suited, such as a particular market in business.
An arrow woven into a prayer rug pointing in the direction of qibla.
A motorhome; a recreational vehicle (RV)
The inherent nature of something.
A section of the Democratic-Republican Party between 1805 and 1811 (from tertium quid).
A sovereign or guinea.
Pound sterling.
definitions.example: Four quid for a toastie? You're joking aren't you?!

definitions.definition: Pound (before the 1966 currency change)
Pound, punt
Euro
A piece of chewing tobacco.
The act of chewing such tobacco
To chew tobacco
(of a horse) To let food drop from the mouth whilst chewing
A paper card on which notes are written, or which is intended for such use
definitions.example: Write your ideas down on notecards.

definitions.definition: A pass entitling the holder to admission to a show, concert, etc.
A pass entitling the holder to board a train, a bus, a plane, or other means of transportation
A citation for a traffic violation.
A permit to operate a machine on a construction site.
A service request, used to track complaints or requests that an issue be handled. (Generally technical support related).
A list of candidates for an election, or a particular theme to a candidate's manifesto.
definitions.example: Joe has joined the party's ticket for the county elections.

definitions.definition: A solution to a problem; something that is needed.
definitions.example: I saw my first bike as my ticket to freedom.

definitions.definition: A little note or notice.
A tradesman's bill or account (hence the phrase on ticket and eventually on tick).
A label affixed to goods to show their price or description.
A certificate or token of a share in a lottery or other scheme for distributing money, goods, etc.
A visiting card.
An electromagnetic wave having a wavelength between approximately 10 and 100 meters, corresponding to frequencies between 3 and 30 MHz.
definitions.example: Shortwaves are longer than microwaves.

definitions.definition: (usually in plural) Any frequency in this range, especially when used in broadcasting.
definitions.example: Many stations broadcast on shortwaves.

definitions.definition: (of radio waves) Having a wavelength of approximately 10 to 100 meters
(of radio equipment) Capable of transmitting or receiving signals at such a wavelength.
To offer a view (of something) from a higher position.
definitions.example: Our hotel room overlooks the lake.

definitions.definition: To fail to notice; to look over and beyond (anything) without seeing it.
definitions.example: These errors were overlooked by the proofreaders.

definitions.definition: To pretend not to have noticed (something, especially a mistake or flaw); to pass over (something) without censure or punishment.
definitions.example: I’m not willing to overlook such bad behaviour.

definitions.definition: To look down upon (something) from a place that is over or above.
definitions.example: to overlook a valley from a hill

definitions.definition: To supervise, oversee; to watch over.
definitions.example: to overlook a gang of laborers

definitions.definition: To observe or watch (someone or something) surreptitiously or secretly.
To inspect (something); to examine; to look over carefully or repeatedly.
To look upon with an evil eye; to bewitch by looking upon; to fascinate.
To make diverse or various in form or quality; to give variety to distinguish by numerous differences or aspects.
A quaternary compound.
The Quaternary period or the system of deposits laid down during it.
Of fourth rank or order
definitions.example: the quaternary stress in a pronounced word

definitions.definition: Of a mathematical expression containing e.g. x4
Relating to or in number base four
Quaternary ammonium
Composed of four elements
To remove or reduce; especially to reduce a quantity or number
definitions.example: If you subtract the $100 for gas from the total cost, it was a fairly inexpensive trip.

definitions.definition: To crouch; huddle as with cold.
To cling closely together.
To embrace by holding closely, especially in the arms.
definitions.example: Billy hugged Danny until he felt better.

definitions.definition: To stay close to (the shore etc.)
To hold fast; to cling to; to cherish.
The act of giving a hug.
Someone (implied male) who delivers the post (mail) to, and/or collects the post from, residential or commercial addresses, or from public mailboxes.
One of the two most experienced barristers in the Court of Exchequer, who have precedence in motions, so called from the place where he sits, the other of the two being the tubman.
One who hikes, especially frequently.
To throw over the edge of a boat into the water.
Outside of a boat, in the water
Over the edge; especially, off or outside of a boat.
definitions.example: It was their practice to throw the scraps overboard.

definitions.definition: Excessively; too much.
definitions.example: They really went overboard with the party preparations.

definitions.definition: A female deity.
A woman honored or adored as physically attractive or of superior charm and intelligence.
A woman of substantial authority or influence.
A cute person or animal.
A clementine: a small, waxy-peeled orange hybrid cultivar that is easy to peel by hand.
(by extension) Any small mandarin orange variety such as a tangerine or a satsuma.
Lacking faith; lacking belief in something.
Not believing in God, religion, or a comparable ideology.
Unfaithful (said of people, towards their partners)
Not observant of promises or covenants.
Not true to allegiance, duty, or vows
Serving to disappoint or deceive
To get back; to recover possession of.
To heat something in preparation for further action, especially cooking
An inexperienced recruit, especially in the police or armed forces.
A novice.
An athlete either new to the sport or to a team or in his first year of professional competition, especially said of baseball, basketball, hockey and American football players.
A type of firecracker, used by farmers to scare rooks.
Obscured by mist or fog; unclear; hazy
Confused, befuddled, etc.
definitions.example: He was still foggy with sleep.

definitions.definition: To emit light.
To reflect light.
To distinguish oneself; to excel.
definitions.example: My nephew tried other sports before deciding on football, which he shone at right away, quickly becoming the star of his school team.

definitions.definition: To be effulgent in splendour or beauty.
To be eminent, conspicuous, or distinguished; to exhibit brilliant intellectual powers.
To be immediately apparent.
To create light with (a flashlight, lamp, torch, or similar).
definitions.example: I shone my light into the darkness to see what was making the noise.

definitions.definition: To cause to shine, as a light.
To make bright; to cause to shine by reflected light.
definitions.example: in hunting, to shine the eyes of a deer at night by throwing a light on them

definitions.definition: A collection of various things; an assortment, mixed bag or motley.
An anthology of miscellaneous prose.
A medley of songs or music.
A mixture of dried fragrant plant material, often in a decorative bowl, used to scent a room.
A ragout or stew of meat and vegetables.
To find fault (with something).
definitions.example: They criticized him for endangering people's lives.

definitions.definition: To evaluate (something), assessing its merits and faults.
Covered with leaves
definitions.example: leafy trees

definitions.definition: Containing much foliage
definitions.example: a leafy avenue

definitions.definition: In the form of leaves (of some material)
Resembling a leaf
(of a place) wealthy, middle- or upper-class
In a passionate manner.
To move one's hand or an object (such as a broom) along (a surface) in one direction.
To hit the ball with the bat in a flowing motion.
To give a finely fluted surface to.
To row the stroke oar of.
definitions.example: to stroke a boat

definitions.definition: The act by which something is stroked.
The act of laying small gathers in cloth in regular order.
A signature, especially on emails or newsgroup postings.
A US marine.
A type of Tibetan, Ladakhi and Nepali dumpling made with a simple flour and water dough.
One who signs or has signed something.
definitions.example: John Hancock is famous for being the first signatory to the American Declaration of Independence, and for writing his name large.

definitions.definition: Relating to a seal; used in sealing.
Signing; joining or sharing in a signature.
definitions.example: signatory powers

definitions.definition: To invigorate; to make energetic.
To supply with energy, especially electricity; to turn on power to (something).
definitions.example: Whenever we energize that circuit we blow a fuse.

definitions.definition: To use strength in action; to act or operate with force or vigor; to act in producing an effect.
To proceed toward maturity: full development or completion (either of concrete or of abstract things, e.g. plans, judgments, qualities).
(of food, especially fruit) To attain maturity, to become mature or ripe.
To bring (something) to maturity, full development or completion.
To make (something, e.g. fruit) ripe or mature.
(of a person) To proceed toward or become mature or full-grown, either physically or psychologically; to gain experience or wisdom with age.
To make (someone) mature.
To reach the date when payment is due.
The lowest limit.
definitions.example: We need a minimum of three staff members on duty at all time.

definitions.definition: The smallest amount.
definitions.example: He always tries to get away with doing the minimum.

definitions.definition: A period of minimum brightness or energy intensity (of a star).
definitions.example: The Maunder minimum of the Sun reportedly corresponded to a period of great cold on Earth.

definitions.definition: A lower bound of a set which is also an element of that set.
The smallest member of a batch or sample or the lower bound of a probability distribution.
A craft involving pulling yarn, thread, or floss through a canvas mesh to produce a decorative design.
An object made using that craft.
Sorrow, grief, misery or anguish.
A unit of pain used to theoretically weigh people's outcomes.
A collection of related web sites which are interlinked in a circular structure, each site having links to the previous and next site in the ring.
Extinguishing a fire.
The profession of being a firefighter.
(by extension) Solving an urgent problem.
To refuse to allow
definitions.example: The prisoners were disallowed to contact with a lawyer.

definitions.definition: To reject as invalid, untrue, or improper
definitions.example: The goal was disallowed because the player was offside.

definitions.definition: To acquire or obtain.
To obtain a person as a prostitute for somebody else.
To induce or persuade someone to do something.
To contrive; to bring about; to effect; to cause.
To solicit; to entreat.
To cause to come; to bring; to attract.
The quality of being excellent.
A beast of burden, much used in desert areas, of the genus Camelus.
A light brownish color, like that of a camel (also called camel brown).
Loaded vessels lashed tightly, one on each side of another vessel, and then emptied to reduce the draught of the ship in the middle.

A ruminant, of the genus Giraffa, of the African savannah with long legs and highly elongated neck, which make it the tallest living animal; yellow fur patterned with dark spots, often in the form of a network; and two or more short, skin-covered horns, so-called; strictly speaking the horn-like projections are ossicones.
A giraffe unicycle.
A laugh.
definitions.example: Are you having a giraffe?!

definitions.definition: In the International System of Units, the base unit of mass; conceived of as the mass of one litre of water, but now defined by taking the fixed numerical value of the Planck constant h to be 6.626 070 15 × 10-34 when expressed in units of kg⋅m2⋅s−1. Symbol: kg
The unit of weight such that a one-kilogram mass is also a one-kilogram weight.
To provide an acceptable explanation for.
definitions.example: How can you justify spending so much money on clothes?

definitions.definition: To be a good, acceptable reason for; warrant.
definitions.example: Nothing can justify your rude behaviour last night.

definitions.definition: To arrange (text) on a page or a computer screen such that the left and right ends of all lines within paragraphs are aligned.
definitions.example: The text will look better justified.

definitions.definition: To absolve, and declare to be free of blame or sin.
To give reasons for one’s actions; to make an argument to prove that one is in the right.
definitions.example: She felt no need to justify herself for deciding not to invite him.

definitions.definition: To prove; to ratify; to confirm.
To show (a person) to have had a sufficient legal reason for an act that has been made the subject of a charge or accusation.
To qualify (oneself) as a surety by taking oath to the ownership of sufficient property.
A process of justification.
Something that causes moisture or a a condition of wetness; something that makes things moist.
definitions.example: The oil acts as a moisturizer to the wood.

definitions.definition: Moisturising cream, emollient.
To send a prisoner back to custody.
To send a case back to a lower court for further consideration.
To send back.
The box in which shoes are sold.
definitions.example: In one shoebox he had a whole collection of seeds he had saved from last year.

definitions.definition: A small, cramped residence or similar space.
To fail to agree; to have a different opinion or belief.
definitions.example: Bob says cats are friendlier than dogs, but I disagree.

definitions.definition: To fail to conform or correspond with.
definitions.example: My results in the laboratory consistently disagree with yours.

definitions.definition: The story or truth.
definitions.example: All the reporters hoped to be the first to get the lowdown on the celebrity's marriage plans.

definitions.definition: Unfair; shameful.
definitions.example: lowdown tactics

definitions.definition: A treasure trove; a collection of treasure.
A collection of things.
To free (something) from pain, worry, agitation, etc.
definitions.example: He eased his conscience by confessing.

definitions.definition: To alleviate, assuage or lessen (pain).
definitions.example: He loosened his shoe to ease the pain.

definitions.definition: To give respite to (someone).
definitions.example: The provision of extra staff eased their workload.

definitions.definition: To loosen or slacken the tension on a line.
definitions.example: We eased the boom vang, then lowered the sail.

definitions.definition: To reduce the difficulty of (something).
definitions.example: We had to ease the entry requirements.

definitions.definition: To move (something) slowly and carefully.
definitions.example: He eased the cork from the bottle.

definitions.definition: To lessen in severity.
definitions.example: The pain eased overnight.

definitions.definition: To proceed with little effort.
definitions.example: The car eased onto the motorway.

definitions.definition: To kill, murder.
definitions.example: Our foes must all be slain.

definitions.definition: To eradicate or stamp out.
definitions.example: You must slay these thoughts.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To defeat, overcome (in a competition or contest).
definitions.example: 1956, “Giants Slay Bears in Pro Title Battle”, in Lodi News-Sentinel, 1956 December 31, page 8.

definitions.definition: To delight or overwhelm, especially with laughter.
definitions.example: Ha ha! You slay me!

definitions.definition: To amaze, stun or otherwise incapacitate by awesomeness; to be awesome at something; to kill (slang sense).
To have sex with
To take something away from (someone) and keep it away; to deny someone something.
To degrade (a clergyman) from office.
To bereave.
(Russian architecture) A fortified, central complex found in various Russian cities.
The field of study concerned with the systematic defense of a position, or of religious or occult doctrines
Exhibiting lust (in the obsolete sense meaning "vigor"); strong, healthy, robust; vigorous; full of sap or vitality.
Hearty, merry, gleesome, enthusiastic, lively, stirring.
Given to experiencing lust; enjoying physical sensations; lustful.
Beautiful; handsome; pleasant.
Of large size; big.
An essential amino acid C4H19NO3 found in most animal proteins.
Inflammation of the brain.
An expert in virtù or art objects and antiquities; a connoisseur.
Someone with special skill or knowledge; an expert.
Specifically, a musician (or other performer) with masterly ability, technique, or personal style.
Exhibiting the ability of a virtuoso.
To make a low, continuous, humming or sibilant sound, like that made by bees with their wings.
To show a high level of activity and haste (alluding to the common simile "busy as a bee"). Often in the colloquial imperative "Buzz off!"
To whisper; to communicate, as tales, in an undertone; to spread, as a report, by whispers or secretly.
To talk to incessantly or confidentially in a low humming voice.
To fly at high speed and at a very low altitude over a specified area, as to make a surprise pass.
To cut the hair in a close-cropped military style, or buzzcut.
To drink to the bottom.
To communicate with (a person) by means of a buzzer.
The action of the verb to buzz.
The sound produced by something that buzzes.
definitions.example: I can hear buzzing coming from the television.

definitions.definition: The eldest son of the king of France. Under the Valois and Bourbon dynasties, the Dauphin of France, generally shortened to Dauphin, was heir apparent to the throne of France. The title derived from the main title of the Dauphin, Dauphin of Viennois.
Allegorical An eldest son.
A musical piece written typically for a solo voice with orchestral accompaniment in an opera or cantata.
A stallion, especially in the sense of mount.
definitions.example: And govern'd him in strength, though not in lust. — Shakespeare, "Venus and Adonis".

definitions.definition: A bicycle.
A petroleum-based thin and colorless fuel oil
Any member of the alkane hydrocarbons.
Paraffin wax.
To impregnate or treat with paraffin.
To embed in paraffin wax.
To bring together as one.
definitions.example: I hope this song can unite people from all different cultures.

definitions.definition: To come together as one.
definitions.example: If we want to win, we will need to unite.

definitions.definition: A substance that acts to increase physiological or nervous activity in the body.
Something that promotes activity, interest, or enthusiasm.
(pharmaceutical effect) Acting as a stimulant.
Producing various optically distorted images.
definitions.example: an anamorphic lens

definitions.definition: Of or relating to the anamorph, an asexual stage in the development of certain fungi.
A subset of a space which is a space in its own right.
Any (often unspecified) method of communicating faster than light speed.
(BDSM) The psychological state of the submissive or "bottom" during sadomasochistic activity.
A strip of wood or iron fastened on transversely to something in order to give strength, prevent warping, hold position, etc.
A continuous metal strip, or angled piece, used to secure metal components.
A device to quickly affix a line or rope, and from which it is also easy to release.
A protrusion on the bottom of a shoe meant for better traction. (See cleats.)
A pair of athletic shoes equipped with cleats.
To strengthen with a cleat.
To tie off, affix, stopper a line or rope, especially to a cleat.
To make real; to convert from the imaginary or fictitious into reality; to bring into real existence
definitions.example: The objectives of the project were never fully realized.

definitions.definition: To become aware of (a fact or situation, especially of something that has been true for a long time).
definitions.example: He realized that he had left his umbrella on the train.

definitions.definition: To cause to seem real; to sense vividly or strongly; to make one's own in thought or experience.
To acquire as an actual possession; to obtain as the result of plans and efforts; to gain; to get
definitions.example: to realize large profits from a speculation

definitions.definition: To convert any kind of property into money, especially property representing investments, such as shares, bonds, etc.
definitions.example: By realizing the company's assets, the liquidator was able to return most of the shareholders' investments.

definitions.definition: To convert into real property; to make real estate of.
To turn an abstract linguistic object into actual language, especially said of a phoneme's conversion into speech sound.
definitions.example: The southern /v/ is realized as the voiced approximant [ʋ].

definitions.definition: Any of a group of various types of grass or its grains used as food, widely cultivated in the developing world.
A semi-autonomous confessional community under the Ottoman Empire, especially a non-Muslim one.
A homosexual.
An inverted arch (as in a sewer). *
The base of a tunnel on which the road or railway may be laid and used when construction is through unstable ground. It may be flat or form a continuous curve with the tunnel arch.
The lowest point inside a pipe at a certain point.
An elevation of a pipe at a certain point along the pipe.
A skateboarding trick where the skater grabs the board and plants a hand on the coping so as to balance upside-down on the lip of a ramp.
Invertebrate
To turn (something) upside down or inside out; to place in a contrary order or direction.
definitions.example: to invert a cup, the order of words, rules of justice, etc.

definitions.definition: To move (the root note of a chord) up or down an octave, resulting in a change in pitch.
To undergo inversion, as sugar.
To divert; to convert to a wrong use.
To turn (the foot) inwards.
Subjected to the process of inversion; inverted; converted.

definitions.definition: To encourage or heavily exert force or influence.
definitions.example: Do not let anyone pressure you into buying something you do not want.

definitions.definition: The act of clarifying; the act or process of making clear or transparent by freeing visible impurities; particularly, the clearing or fining of liquid substances from feculent matter by the separation of the insoluble particles which prevent the liquid from being transparent.
definitions.example: The clarification of wine.

definitions.definition: The act of freeing from obscurities.
definitions.example: Your ideas deserve clarification.

definitions.definition: A vivid red synthetic pigment made of mercury sulfide.
A bright orange-red colour.
A type of red dye worn in the parting of the hair by married Hindu women.
The red skin of the lips or its border with the skin of the face.
The kermes or cochineal insect.
The cochineal dye made from this insect.
To color or paint vermilion.
Having a brilliant red colour.
Having the color of the vermilion dye.
To smile, parting the lips so as to show the teeth.
definitions.example: Why do you grin?  Did I say something funny?

definitions.definition: To express by grinning.
definitions.example: She grinned pleasure at his embarrassment.

definitions.definition: To show the teeth, like a snarling dog.
To grin as part of producing a particular facial expression, such as a smile or sneer.
definitions.example: He grinned a broad smile when I told him the result.

definitions.definition: To render disjoint; to remove a connection, linkage, or intersection.
definitions.example: to disjoint limbs; to disjoint bones; to disjoint poultry by carving

definitions.definition: To break the natural order and relations of; to make incoherent.
definitions.example: a disjointed speech

definitions.definition: To fall into pieces.
Not smooth or continuous; disjointed.
Of two or more sets, having no members in common; having an intersection equal to the empty set.
